job title: Senior Associate Scientist, Medicinal Chemistry (non PhD)
job description:
We are seeking a creative, highly motivated, and experienced synthetic organic chemist to join our Pfizer Global Research and Development laboratories based in Groton, CT. The successful applicant will demonstrate a passion for the theory and laboratory practice of synthetic organic chemistry. He/she will have a proven track record of productivity in generating high-quality technical and scientific results. As part of a medicinal chemistry team, he/she will contribute to the implementation and execution of project chemistry strategy and, through development of innovative chemistry, contribute to the rapid and efficient delivery of clinical candidate molecules.
  • *RESPONSIBILITIES**
+ Design, refine and enable synthetic routes to target molecules including versatile, modular routes for analog generation and efficient scalable routes for preclinical candidates. As needed, employ enabled routes to make analogs in singleton or parallel format.

+ As a strong team player, work within interdisciplinary project teams to deliver on project goals via collaboration and clear communication (written and oral).

+ Understand project medicinal chemistry strategy and work with the synthesis team to develop a coherent approach for the efficient delivery of target molecules in support of the strategy, be it in the dimensions of prototype synthesis, analogue production or compound scale-up.

+ Build effective partnerships with other research lines, in particular analytical, technology, pharmaceutical sciences and process chemistry groups.

+ Publish and present research internally and externally to Pfizer.
  • *BASIC QUALIFICATIONS**
+ BS degree with 2+ years of organic chemistry experience or MS degree required.
  • *PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS**
+ Proven track record of innovation and consistent project impact.

+ Experience in multistep synthesis; experience in methodology development is valued.

+ Familiarity in either organometallic chemistry, catalysis, peptide chemistry or chemical biology is highly recommended.

+ A skilled synthetic organic chemist in practice and theory: firm understanding of reaction mechanisms and reactivity, familiar with a range of reaction types, conditions and scales, knowledge of purification methods and characterization of organic compounds, especially NMR and mass spectroscopy.

+ Capable of working independently to solve problems through careful experiment design, data analysis, and mechanistic insight.

+ Capable of independent design/refinement of synthetic routes taking into account the needs of the project (e.g., analogue generation, scale-up).

+ Effective communication skills (oral and written); must be able to interact effectively within a multidisciplinary team of colleagues. Builds strong working relationships with fellow scientists.

+ Self-aware; will seek input from others on ideas and problem-solving; uses others as a resource.

+ Change agile, capable of quickly adapting to changes in project direction, project portfolio, reporting relationships and department organization.

+ Responds well to scientific challenges and applies significant rigor to their own work.

+ Will scientifically challenge fellow colleagues in a constructive manner.

+ A regular reader of chemical literature with an up-to-date knowledge of cutting edge developments in synthesis.
